title: HTML
description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard markup language used to create web pages.

title: CSS
description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language.

title: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is a programming language that is commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.

title: React
description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

title: Node.js
description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment.

title: PHP
description: PHP is a server-side scripting language designed for web development.

title: Python
description: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language.

title: Ruby
description: Ruby is an open-source, interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language.

title: Java
description: Java is a general-purpose programming language that is class-based, object-oriented, and designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

title: Verbal communication
description: Verbal communication refers to the use of spoken language to communicate a message.

title: Written communication
description: Written communication refers to the use of written language, symbols, and numbers to communicate a message.

title: Collaboration
description: Collaboration refers to the process of working together with others to achieve a common goal.

title: Problem solving
description: Problem solving refers to the process of identifying and solving problems.

title: Time management
description: Time management refers to the process of planning and organizing how to allocate time effectively and efficiently.
